awd_titl_txt: Florida Atlantic University Data-Driven Science and AI Conference
awd_abstract_narration:
This project will support the participation of junior researchers (students, postdocs, and early-career faculty members) in the 2022 Data Science and Analytics conference that will be held on February 12, 2022,  at the Center for Data-Driven Science on the campus of the Florida Atlantic University. This is the fourth such conference hosted by the  FAU College of Science. The conference aims to facilitate interdisciplinary interactions and collaborations in data science and artificial Intelligence for scientific discovery. It is anticipated that the interactions fostered by this conference will lead to cross-disciplinary collaborations as well as new ideas needed to accelerate progress towards a better understanding of the mathematical foundations of artificial intelligence in the context of fundamental and applied physics applications.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The FAU Data Science and AI Conference was held on May 21, 2022. The conference included three plenary talks, six research minisymposia, two panel discussions, and a student poster session. https://www.fau.edu/data/

The conference was a forum for faculty, students, and local industry leaders to interact and discuss current and future directions of data science and AI in scientific discovery and applied science.

Participants were provided with an overview of state-of-the-art data science and AI tools. Current data science and AI methods were presented in the areas of biomedicine, molecular chemistry, economics, geosciences, applied mathematics, neuroscience, physics, and urban and regional planning.

It also gave students an opportunity to showcase their work and interact with faculty and industry leaders. Specifically, they obtained experience in giving academic presentations through the poster session and observing talks. They also obtained information about career paths and internship opportunities through the panel discussions. Leaders from the local South Florida techology community presented two panel discussions on Digital Transformation and Data-Driven Insight in Healthcare: Where We Are and Where We?re Going and Data/AI and Tech Career and Internship Experience with the latter panel aimed at students. 

The conference was well-attended with over 225 registrants and more than 150 participants, including 80 students registered and 24 students (high school, undergraduate, and graduate) presenting posters.

 


Last Modified: 03/09/2023
Modified by: William D Kalies
